abtest0.name: abtest0
abtest0.title: Joining storage nodes to NooBaa: a, b, test, demo, nodes, storage
abtest0.subtitle: When to use Sync vs Cloud Storage
abtest0.body:
Last Updated: Aug 30, 2017 02:42PM PDT

A storage node is a machine with an operating system, CPU, memory, and file system. By installing NooBaa daemon, you actually turn this machine into NooBaa storage node and can start using it as a storage target for NooBaa.

Steps:

  1. Go to Overview > Install nodes

  2. In the install nodes Wizard “Assign” step you need to choose the target pool for the future installed nodes. A pool is a group of nodes created by the administrator to reflect specific characteristics of these nodes. It can be a physical location, performance or any other characteristics. NooBaa’s machine learning algorithm will use this grouping in addition to real-time monitoring of the nodes in order to suggest grouping for any newly introduced node.

  3. In the wizard “select drives” step you will need to choose rather use the installed nodes drives as it is (include all drives) or exclude some of the drives from the upcoming installation.
    To exclude drive choose the second option and type drives name accurately. After each name hit “enter” key.

    * You can also prepare all the drives names in a separate note document (write a drive name and hit enter) and copy the list directly to the Exclude drives text field.
    * Drives names can be Windows or Linux compatible - at the installation string we will use only the relevant names according to the os type.



  4. In “Install” step you will need to copy the installation script according to the machine OS type (you can copy both if needed) and paste it to a distribution tool (any distribution tool, including Puppet, Chef, SCCM, will work as well).


All nodes will be assigned to the pool you’ve chosen in the first step and can be found under Resources > Pools > Resource name
​

abtest1.name: abtest1
abtest1.title: Minimum requirements: a, c, test
abtest1.subtitle: When to use Sync vs Cloud Storage
abtest1.body:
Recommended OVA VM settings:
  • 8 CPUs, 16GB RAM or A3, A4 or A7 on Azure marketplace.
  • Firewall - The nodes need network access on port 8443 to the VM.
  • The nodes and the core VM need network access one to another on one of the ports 60100-60600 (configurable).​
  • Three windows or Linux nodes, each with more than 15GB free space.
  • Alternatively, you can connect only cloud resource (Azure blob storage or AWS S3) and start working immediately.

abtest3.name: abtest3
abtest3.title: Create a new nodes pool: a, d
abtest3.subtitle: When to use Sync vs Cloud Storage
abtest3.body:
Nodes pool is a group of storage nodes that can be used for a data placement policy within NooBaa's buckets. All assigned storage nodes in each pool will be used for capacity aggregation.

Steps:

  1. Go to Resources > Node Pools > Create Pool

  2. Type a valid pool name according to the name constraints

  3. Assign nodes to the new pool by moving them from other pools.
  • All currently used nodes will have to go through a migration process.
  • Each pool must have at least 3 nodes (for data replicas).

  • Make sure that the nodes you choose to move from another pool will not leave that pool with less than 3 nodes. If it does, that pool could no longer be available for data placement.

abtest4.name: abtest4
abtest4.title: Create a cloud resource: a, d
abtest4.subtitle: When to use Sync vs Cloud Storage
abtest4.body:
A cloud resource can be either an Azure blob storage, AWS S3 bucket or any AWS S3 compatible service. Cloud resource can be used for NooBaa's bucket data placement policy

Steps:

  1. Go to Resources > Cloud Storage > Add Cloud Resource

  2. In the target connection drop-down select “Add new connection” to create a new public cloud connection access or choose an existing one.

  3. Choose a target bucket you wish to use for storage purposes (this bucket will store the files uploaded to the NooBaa bucket you will decide to connect. This data will only be readable with NooBaa access)

  4. Edit the resource name according to the system names rules - this name cannot be edited later on.

  5. Click “Create” and the new resource will be added to the cloud storage list. This might take a few minutes of initializing the resource.

    If you got an error, please check the following article about
